intro: Aframomum chrysanthum, commonly known as the golden nutmeg, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, rhizomatous growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and has a distinct, spicy fragrance similar to nutmeg. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice. The botanical features of Aframomum chrysanthum make it an important species in both horticulture and ethnobotanical studies.
